result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy Sims was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence defendant is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain employment.
No contact with the victim Devron D. or coactor Sharod Rimmer.
Comply with the standard rules of Extended Supervision.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment. Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample unless previously done, pay surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy Sims

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA / SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (22 pages) commencing JUNE 29, 2015, received and filed.  jm

Defendant Jeremy Sims in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Jeremy Sims in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 54 MONTHS, concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 36 MONTHS.
Credit given for 76 days time served.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 2):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victim. Devron D.
* No contact with the co-actor, Sharod Rimmer.
* Complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain employment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Defendant Jeremy Sims in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Jeremy Sims in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 2:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court, defendant Jeremy Sims not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
Case adjourned to 06-29-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Jeremy Sims in court with attorney Lisa Procaccio for Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Jeremy Sims in custody.  Ronald Dague for Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Devron D (10/8/1991); Curtis C ( 07/16/1990); and Co-Actor: Sharod Rimmer.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jeremy Sims in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Jeremy Sims in custody.  
Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jeremy Sims
Current: 912 W Clark Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 04-18-2015)
Prior: 3210 West Wells Street # 310, Milwaukee, WI 53208
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
